Swim Like A Pro | U.S. Masters Swimming Menu My Account Community/Forums USMS Website Logout Training Events Club Finder Workout Library About Us Join Search Log In Home Club Finder Swim Like A Pro + View Full Image × Swim Like A Pro A fun, social, and competitive Masters Swimming and Triathlon Team located in multiple cities and pools in Central Florida. We provide group swim practices, stroke technique sessions, swim meet competition, triathlon training, open water races, and fun team adventure challenges! Practice Information NATIONAL TRAINING CENTER (1935 Don Wickham Dr, Clermont): Monday/Wednesday/Friday - 6:00a-7:00a Tuesday/Thursday - 12:00-1:00p Tuesday/Thursday - 7:00-8:00p ~~~~ WATERFRONT PARK OPEN WATER (330 3rd St, Clermont): Saturday - (winter) 10:00a-11:30p, (summer) 7:00-8:30a ~~~~ CELEBRATION FITNESS CENTER (400 Celebration Place): Tuesday & Thursday - 6:30-7:30p ~~~~ Fees: $10 for a single drop-in swim $75 per month for unlimited swims **COVID CANCELATIONS: We are still waiting for these locations to allow us to resume practices. Stay tuned on our website for updates (swim-like-a-pro.com): ~~~~ WINDERMERE PREP SCHOOL (6189 Winter Garden-Vineland Rd) ST. CLOUD CHRIS LYLE AQUATIC CENTER (3001 17th St, St. Cloud) 92 AdventHealth Wellness Center - Celebration 400 Celebration Boulevard Celebration, FL 34747 25m Indoor Pool 98 Chris Lyle Aquatic Center 2991 17th Street St Cloud, FL 34769 25y Outdoor Pool 98 National Training Center 1935 Don Wickham Drive Clermont, FL 34711 25y Outdoor Pool 98 Waterfront Park 330 3rd Street Clermont, FL 34711 Lake Open Water Contact Swim Like A Pro First Name Last Name Email Address Phone Number Are you a current USMS member? Yes No What are you looking for? Attend a practice Find a coach Join a club Message Sign up for updates from USMS Join USMS Now Club Contact Sara McLarty 386-747-4324 sara@swim-like-a-pro.com Visit Club Website Club Designations USMS Certified Coach USMS Certified Gold Club Connect With Us × USMS Certified Coaches The U.S. Masters Swimming–Certified Coach logo identifies swim clubs near me where you can find a USMS-certified coach. These coaches have furthered their Masters coaching education and have passed the certification exam. Note: A certified coach might not be at all locations or workouts. × Gold Club Designation The Gold Club logo identifies Masters clubs and workout groups that provide members with the best Masters Swimming experience possible. Gold Clubs have a U.S. Masters Swimming–certified coach on staff, participate in fitness events, and offer a free trial to potential members, among many other benefits. × USMS Certified Adult Learn-to-Swim Instructors The Certified Adult Learn-to-Swim Instructor logo identifies swim teams near me that have a U.S. Masters Swimming–certified ALTS instructor. These instructors have furthered their swim-lessons instruction education and have passed the certification exam. Note: A certified ALTS instructor might not be at all locations or workouts. × USA Swimming Foundation The USA Swimming Foundation logo identifies clubs that receive support from the foundation for their adult swim-lessons program. These grant programs offer adult learn-to-swim lessons at a reduced cost. Most also are led by a USMS-certified adult learn-to-swim instructor. About USMS What is Masters Swimming? Microsoft no longer supports Internet Explorer so you will experience issues on our website and others. Please use another browser like: Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, or Apple Safari. Accept {

Chris Lyle Aquatic Center About Sugar Mill Amenities Testimonials Community News Request Info Request Info for Sugar Mill Your Message* * Required Fields Chris Lyle Aquatic Center April 29, 2013 Chris Lyle Aquatic  Center 3001 17th St., St. Cloud , FL , 34769 Aqua-Fit Aqua-Fit class is only held if weather permits. Three participants must be present to hold a class. Monday – Friday @ 8:00 am and 11:00 am Monday - Thursday @ 6:00 pm Saturday @ 11:00 am Cost - $1.00 for pool members, $2.50 for non-pool members, $3.50 non-pool, non-county residents Water Pilates Resuming April 30 th this thirty minute class offers a challenging, mind-body workout for everyone – especially aqua exercisers, fitness swimmers, Pilate’s enthusiasts and dancers! Tuesday and Thursday’s Noon Cost - $1.00 for pool members, $2.50 for non-pool members, $3.50 non-pool, non-county residents Return to Community News Return to Sugar Mill Home Page Sugar Mill 3130 A Sugar Mill Lane Saint Cloud, FL 34769 (407) 957-3055 SugarMill@ARCinvestments.com Community Brochure Home | Communities | News | About ARC | Contact Us | Site Map | Privacy Policy Communities: California | New Mexico | Michigan | Florida © 2025 ARC Investments.

Human Resources | City of St. Cloud, Florida - Official Website Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In City Government Services Business Community How Do I... Search Home City Government Departments Human Resources Human Resources Human Resources Mission Our mission is to develop and implement effective policies while providing quality services which are in the best interest of the City; recruit and retain a trained, qualified, and diverse workforce that exceeds community expectations; provide a safe and healthy work environment; identify and minimize risks of loss associated with the provision of City services. Human Resources Vision Our vision is to be responsive, courteous and supportive and to continuously develop and seek to improve our quality of customer service through constant self-evaluation and professional growth. Why St. Cloud? Join the City of St. Cloud, where our core values of accountability, empowerment, innovation, and ownership shape everything we do. Here's what we offer: Meaningful Work: Be part of projects that truly impact our community, knowing your contributions make a difference. Work-Life Balance: We prioritize a healthy balance between your career and personal life, empowering you to thrive in both. Generous Benefits: Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package that supports your well-being and offers peace of mind for you and your family. Job security: Build a stable and rewarding career with a city that values accountability and dedication. Technical Skill Development: Gain hands-on experience and develop expertise while exploring innovative approaches to your work. Countless Opportunities: Discover diverse career paths and grow with us as you take ownership of your professional journey. Community Investment: Play an active role in enhancing and strengthening our community and take pride in seeing the tangible results of your efforts. Make your career matter. Join our team and contribute to a city that is as committed to growth and excellence as you are! To Apply: https://www.governmentjobs.com/careers/stcloud For more information, reach out to us at human.resources@stcloudfl.gov Contact Us Justin Kluesner Senior Director, Human Resources & Administrative Services Email Justin Kluesner Phone: 407-957-7359 Equal Employment Officer Justin Kluesner St Cloud, FL 34769 Human Resources Director 407-957-7359 Report a Concern Justin Kluesner Human Resources Director 407-957-7359 Contact Us Human Resources Department Email Human Resources Physical Address 1300 9th Street Building A - 2nd Floor St. Cloud , FL 34769 Phone: 407-957-8420 Fax: 407-957-7273 ADA Committee Information Benefits Employee Health Clinic City of St. Cloud Retirement System Division of Retirement's Actuarial Summary Resources for the City of St. Cloud Retirees Come Grow With St. Cloud Employee Assistance Program Employee Self Service - ESS Employment Opportunities Frequently Asked Questions Internship/Volunteer Programs Notify Me Risk Management Residents Visitors Businesses Residents Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information Public Records Request /QuickLinks.aspx Visitors Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information /QuickLinks.aspx Businesses Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information /QuickLinks.aspx GIS Maps Floodplain Management City Meeting / Event Calendar View community events & meetings Return to City of St. Cloud home page. Contact City Hall 1300 9th Street St. Cloud, FL 34769 Phone: 407-957-7300 Popular Pages Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information /QuickLinks.aspx Site Links Home Contact Us Accessibility Site Map Copyright Notices /QuickLinks.aspx Under Florida Law, email addresses are public records If you do not want your email address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone or in writing. (SB 80 Florida State Law.) Committees & Boards  | City of St. Cloud, Florida - Official Website Skip to Main Content Create a Website Account - Manage notification subscriptions, save form progress and more. Website Sign In City Government Services Business Community How Do I... Search Home City Government Committees & Boards Committees & Boards Board Structure Duties Vacancies Board of Appeals Location / Date TBD • 5 members • Experience with building and property maintenance • At-large To hear appeals of decisions made by the Building Official 0 Community Redevelopment Agency Meets every other month; 1st Thursday 3 PM Building Department Conference Room • Five elected City Council members and two appointed volunteer members • …Must reside or be engaged in business within the area of operation of the agency, which shall be coterminous with the area of operation of the county or municipality… • Carry out activities within the CRA area; developing budgets, creating contracts with service providers, implementing elements of the CRA master plan and approving CRA related expenses 0 Economic Development Advisory Committee Meets 3rd Wednesday each month 5 PM Community Development Conference Room • Must be registered voter Osceola County • Must meet one or more of the following: 1) Resident of the City of St. Cloud 2) Own real property within the City of St. Cloud 3) Own and operate a business with a business location within the City of St. Cloud • Provide the City Manager and City Council with business related recommendations on sustaining, generating and developing economic growth within the City of St. Cloud 0 Finance Committee Meets quarterly (January, April, July, and October); 4th Tuesday 6 PM Council Chambers •	Members must be city residents •	Five voting members – coterminous with Council terms •	Make recommendations to the City Council regarding budgets, debt service, financial policies, and capital expenditures •	Review the fiscal activities of the City 0 General Employee Pension Board of Trustees Meets quarterly; 2nd Tuesday 1:30 PM City Hall Bldg A -  DRC Conference Room •	Seven voting members •	Three members are appointed by City Council;  four members are elected by employees •	Oversee the asset management of the General Employee Pension Funds 0 Historic Preservation Board Meets 1st Tuesday of every other month 6 PM Council Chambers • Seven voting members and two alternates appointed by Council • Preference to individuals who reside or have principal place of business in City of St. Cloud • Members chosen from among disciplines of architecture, archaeology history, architectural history, landscape architecture, construction, construction management, engineering, planning, general contractor, commercial development, real estate, banking or law • Reviews all changes to historically significant structures within the historic district. Holds public hearings and issues Certificates of Appropriateness. • Coordinates with the State of Florida’s Division of Historical Resources Certified Local Government program • Collaborates with the St. Cloud Main Street organization and any other organization to inform and educate citizens concerning the historic, cultural, archaeological and architectural heritage of the City 2 Planning Commission Meets 3rd Tuesday each month; 6:00 PM Council Chambers •	Five voting members and two alternates •	Members cannot serve on the Zoning Board of Adjustment simultaneously •	Members must be city residents and registered voters – Non coterminous with Council terms •	Act in an advisory capacity to the City Council relating to zoning, land use, and the Comprehensive Plan 0 Police and Firefighters Pension Board of Trustees Meets quarterly; 3rd Tuesday 4:00 PM City Hall Bldg A -  DRC Conference Room •	Five voting members •	Two members are appointed by Council; one by the Fire Department,  one by the Police Department and one is Board appointed •	Oversee the asset management of the Police Department and Fire Department pension funds 0 Recreation Advisory Committee Meets 3rd Wednesday each month; 5:30 PM Civic Center •	Five voting members, coterminous with Council terms. •	Two alternate members with 1 year calendar terms •	No more than 2 voting members can be County residents. •	Alternates move into vacancies of regular seats except at expiration of terms. •	Work in cooperation with the Parks and Recreation Department to plan and implement programs and facilities for all residents 1 Veterans Council NOTE: Applications to this board are accepted only if appointed by City Council 0 Zoning Board of Adjustment Meets 2nd Wed. each month 6:30 PM Council Chambers • Members cannot serve on the Planning Commission simultaneously • Members must be city residents and registered voters • Five voting members and two alternates – Non coterminous with Council terms • Grant variances • Perform the administrative review • Reverse the decisions of the Building Official as it relates to zoning codes 0 To apply, click the name of the board / committee to complete the online application.  Interested in applying? If you have questions, please contact Stacey Wilde, City Clerk's Office, 407-957-7388 or by email at stacey.wilde@stcloudfl.gov Residents Visitors Businesses Residents Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information Public Records Request /QuickLinks.aspx Visitors Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information /QuickLinks.aspx Businesses Burn Permit City Council City Manager Public Safety Solid Waste Services Recycling Information /QuickLinks.aspx GIS Maps Floodplain Management City Meeting / Event Calendar View community events & meetings Return to City of St. Cloud home page.
